comment: Not the hardest class but she does have a good amount of papers due at random times. BEWARE IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A CAR! You WILL get placements in this course which can be up to an hour away! She technically does not place us but still for future reference! Caring professor but has tricky grading as there is almost never a rubric.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Mrs.Johnson has a very bubbly personality that makes you excited for the class. Her assignments don't have clear criteria and your grade will take the hit, but she lets you resubmit and its point based. Being a hybrid and a field hour class its easy to forget. If you're not afraid of speaking up, take her.

Professor Johnson is very nice and personable and obviously is passionate about what she teaches. There's only a few assignments through the semester and they're all pretty easy. She doesn't care if you turn stuff in late and is understanding about college work load. Just go to class and you'll be good.

Mrs. Monique is one of the BEST professors I've ever had, she explains the material so well, especially if you have questions. You usually only have 1 assignment per week, and the course requires a classroom observation placement. She's so understanding of students lives, and lenient on assignments and redoing them if you need. No midterm or final!

LOOOVE, LOVEEE Mrs.Monique! Such good energy & always so smiley! Love how she enjoys making class fun and involved. Knows exactly what she's doing when it comes to education and shows she loves what she does. Also, I've learned so much through her lectors.
She is an okay professor. Very interesting and very laid back, but the class itself was boring. The assignments are pretty easy, but she will grade harshly.

She is very biased in this class! Unless you are her favorite good luck. She also accuses at least 4 students of plagiarism on many assignments. We will NOT work with you even if you have been in the hospital/ sick all semester. She is also not fair. She will tell your friends and peers something other than what she tells you.

Although she is sweet, she is hard to reach outside of class. She also accuses students of plagiarism when they pass through plagiarism websites. She accused me and 4 others of plagiarism on different assignments and could not prove otherwise. She does not work with you if you are sick or does not care if you were in the hospital. I don't recommend
I would take this class again. She would love it if you could bring your little ones in. She only has a few things to do throughout the semester.
Don't take her!

Changes her syllabus with one week left of class, had a B all year until she decided to count attendance and fail you if you missed 3 or more days of class. Very rude, and political, when this class wasn't even based around the political aspect of education. She needs to be asked to step down from the education department, overall a rude professor.

Keeps the workload chill and relevant, and keeps class interesting. Only a handful of assignments outside of class. Particular about getting assignments right, but allows revisions. Will say, there are certain current issues where she makes her opinion known. Being of a different political/religious affiliation, I stayed quiet in those discussions.

Though this course isn't offered anymore, this professor knows what she's talking about. You basically have one assignment per week, and it usually doesn't take long except for a few things. She takes attendance. Don't bother with the textbooks, it's okay to opt-out. She says not to but we didn't rely on them for anything except one assignment.

she is a great prof, all of the assignments are super easy&she changes the due dates if she sees we are falling behind. I'm not sure what ill end with but so far I have gotten all 100s there's only two quizzes, two papers, a group final project&a couple of assignments but she does say you can only miss 1-3 classes which is not difficult

Would have passed easily if her team hadnt decided that instead of taking points of for attendance they were going to drop you a whole letter grade. Did all assignments on time but if you miss 3 or more classes excused or not; expect to fail honestly.

I attended every class except the last two classes, and until then, she seemed funny and caring , and I liked her. I broke my ankle and she had no mercy on me. If there were more characters, I'd explain, but she doesn't communicate well and is rude. If you attend every class and work hard, you're probably fine, just don't have any emergencies.

Took a class with Professor Johnson towards the beginning of my college career. When taking her class this semester, I realized nothing has changed in her teaching skills. She is unapproachable and condescending when you have questions. Her communication skills are rather poor and most likely underdeveloped. Save your GPA - find a different teacher
Monique hurt my feelings. She only cared about attendance abruptly at the end. She has done this to other students in the past as well. I do not recommend her, but if you take her, GO TO CLASS.

Dr. Johnson was a fine teacher, her material wasn't difficult per say, but her attitude was very rude and petty. She was not shy to show favorites, and would call people out very rudely in front of the whole class. Overall she was a tough grader, but she would allow you to resubmit an assignment. I would not recommend her if you get hurt feelings.

Dr. Johnson was a good professor. She was kind, funny, and genuinely cared out her students. My only complaint about her class is that she waited until last minute to assign us everything, so the end of the semester was a bit overwhelming. She's kinda strict on projects. I still liked her though.

i'm 1/2 through her class anddd she calls specific students out, she loads a million of assignments on you and doesn't have the decency to remind you about them and has no regard to your other courses. Her D2L page is unorganized and complicated. Discussion is great, but I wouldn't take her again unless I really have to...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She was very good at her job I felt like she was interested in what she was teaching. I found the lectures interesting and helpful for the future. She grades tough on projects but follow the rubric. Stay on top of assignments cause she wont remind you. Show up to class because it's a big part of your grade.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Johnson is pretty good. I really liked her until the last assignment. Her class was interesting to me because she told very interesting stories to help you understand things. Overall, the work isnt a lot and is very easy. I just wish she was more organized.
I wish the Professor had clear directions and communicated easily but other than that, easy class. Work hard, do the assignments, and you will get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Okay at first but suddenly made attendance the biggest deal out of nowhere. She made it worth more than all of the assignments except one and didn't announce it until the 2nd to last class. Would make fun of students when they gave wrong answers online. If you missed a class she would act like she didn't know you. All around petty and rude.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: She is okay. What we talked about in class never correlated to what assignments were due at the end of the week. She never had good directions for assignments, so I would get bad grades on some things because she was not clear. SHe emails back quickly, and nothing is too hard. No tests only 2 online quizzes.

Hybrid class, everyone in the class agrees that we haven't learned anything. Easy A, just do the assignments and you'll be fine. Isn't the best about answering emails but again it's an easy A with her so just take her, you'll be fine.

My favorite class so far! Johnson is so understanding and she wants you to take this information and be better rather than just test and quiz you! We did not have a mid-term or a final, but participation is key! Do your readings because they help! Never was overly stressed during this class. This course reassured me that I wanted to do Education!!!

Ms. Johnson was a professor that I had mixed feelings about. She was very nice and gave great lectures however she didn't tell us when assignments were due till like 2 days before which bothered a lot of us. Since it's a hybrid class, switching fully to online due to the virus was easy but she did give a lot of work.

Please do not take this professor. She is the worst professor I've have at KSU yet. She is very rude and makes things difficult for absolutley no reason. I have never expereinced a more diffult professor than Ms. Johnson. PLEASE DO NOT TAKE HER.

I really liked Professor Johnson. She is kind of unclear about some assignments and due dates, but if you look at the rubric, it's all on there. Also she is not extremely strict on due dates. She gives great feedback on assignments and gives you the chance to re-do if you get below a 100. Overall very caring and great professor! But go to class.

Her class is not extremely hard, however she is very rude. She is very strict on attendance and complains if you are two minutes late. She isn't clear about due dates so you will have to ask multiple questions about assignments.

Prof Johnson is great! Don't let the negative reviews fool you. Those complaining about her harsh grading or unclear expectations: FOLLOW THE RUBRIC, easy A! Complaints of communication: Stop waiting to be told what to do, and just DO THE WORK, easy A! If you can't manage YOUR OWN education, how are you going to manage the education of children???

Prof. Johnson is great, fair, and just. She is clear of what is expected of us, and is accessible if you need clarification. I had issues with my field exp. site and she helped me out. Kindness goes a long way, so does common sense. Be adults, take responsibility for your own work, follow the rubrics and you'll earn an A easily. Just DO THE WORK!

Professor Johnson is one of the best professors I have ever had. She holds students accountable for their education. She's extremely knowledgeable and applies her ton of experience to what we're learning. A syllabus is provided the first day of class, AND a rubric is provided for every assignment. All you have to do is follow those and do the work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Very knowledgeable, but RUDE. Not clear on assignments, not helpful either. Dont even think about emailing her about anything. ALLL the other ECE professors want to see you succeed and are willing to help. If you can avoid her class, please do!

Ms. Johnson should not be a professor. She is not understanding that students have a life outside of school. All the assignments are unclear and she never answers questions we might have. She changed her syllabus and attendance policy halfway through the semester. I worked really hard on my assignments but she grades so harshly. Do not recommend
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Ms. Johnson is very passionate about early childhood education, but she should not be a professor. She is unclear about assignments that are due. I took this as a 3 hour class and many assignments could've been completed in class. Instead, we had to do 60 hrs field experience and STILL had so much work to do outside of class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She had never taught ths class before and used another teachers content she didn't know what we had to do. She said, she would be getting rid of stuff and she never did which resulted in everyone scrambling at the end of the semester. I sent emails and asked for help in class and she would be super rude. I redid 80% of my work. Do not take her!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She will work with you if you are struggling in her class. Books aren't really necessary. The only complaint is that she is never clear on her assignments. You have to specifically ask questions to understand what she wants from you. She is an easy grader. Classes are fun, we have activities each day which are fun to do.

Easy class but Professor Johnson is very unorganized. The assignment expectations are never clear and she completely changes instructions multiple times so you never know what to do. She takes away points for not having things that she never said to include. Very confusing.
DO NOT take this class online. Professor Johnson is very unclear on what she wants and does not give clear direction online. About every single week we were all emailing her confused.

TAKE THIS CLASS AS A LECTURE; NOT ONLINE. The curriculum and assignments for the class did not add up. I didn't think I would have to do anything outside of my laptop since it was online. We had to observe kids and visit a museum for a few projects, which I was not expecting to do. We also had group projects, and those are hard when it's online.

Professor Johnson was honestly a great teacher. She was a harsh grader though, and never told us a lot about what was expected with projects. There were a few essays and projects that was the major point of our grades. The only part is attendance and participation on special days. Overall a good class, just be prepared for lots of assignments.

Dr. Johnson was a pretty good teacher. Unfortunately, the class I took was a hybrid class so we only got an hour a week and that was basically it. There weren't any online assignments. Only in class assignments and a group project at the end of the semester. I wish the class was longer, but overall I had a great experience.
It was a mix of lectures, interactive activities, and group work. She is very funny and enthusiastic about the information she is teaching. There are no tests only written assgnments and projects.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Johnson is very well liked and easy, but at the same time if you have a conflict come up with her she is very disrespectful. She is not willing to work with you and she would rather fail you than help. Easy A but stay on her good side.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Monique is my favorite professor I have had at KSU. She is so knowledgable in her field & very passionate about child development & this shows in her lectures and class. I learned so much info that I will use in my future career and in life in general. The course is mostly discussion based, with a few assignments, 1 quiz, and a group presentation
She's a great professor. Strict attendance policy, but she makes class interesting.
Very nice professor who truly shows she cares. Interesting lectures with fun activities! Would definitely take again!

Professor Johnson is my favorite professor so far at KSU. She makes a 3 hour 8am class funny and interesting. Her stories are great and she makes you feel welcome in the classroom! For our class, she went over assignments, but didnt enforce due dates. Obviously I procrastinated, but I still got an A in the class. Show up to class and do the work!

The whole semester was very confusing. She was not very clear with the assignments & she does not grade at ALL. The semester is over & the only grades I have are the online quizzes (which are easy & you get 3 chances). Overall the class is long & boring & you won't know how you are doing at all during the semester. Lesson plan was crazy, too!!
Best professor I've ever had. Really explains things in a way that makes it easy to understand.

Professor Johnson is WONDERFUL! She does read from the powerpoint, but she has SO much experience and hilarious stories that make lecture interesting. She is so smart and has so much to offer. I am taking her next semester for ECE 3313 and I cannot wait to get back into her class. Tests were so easy and class was so enjoyable. TAKE HER!!!!!!!!

Overall this class has been extremely laid back and all she does is read the power points to us. Now that it is the last couple weeks of school she has dumped basically the entire semesters work on us including projects other classes had all semester to do. No communication or grades given back. I ask for feedback on an assignment and never got it.
